New Records: Jason Holder took four wickets in four balls, joining Sri Lanka's Lasith Malinga, Afghanistan's Rashid Khan, and Ireland's Curtis Campher as the only men to achieve this in a T20 international.
Jason Holder achieved a career-best return of five for 27 in 2.5 overs.
Jason Holder was named both player of the match and series after taking 15 wickets across the five games.
Key Match Events: Jason Holder took four wickets in successive balls during the last over, leading West Indies to a 17-run victory.
Akeal Hosein slowed England's progress with a format-best four for 30.
James Vince top-scored for England with 55 runs.
Kieron Pollard led a late run-spree with a rapid 41 not out.
Rovman Powell contributed with 35 not out, sharing an unbroken stand of 74 in five overs with Kieron Pollard.
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Holder expressed pride in his performance and love for playing at Kensington Oval.
Kieron Pollard highlighted the team's total effort and capitalizing with the bat in the last four overs.
Moeen Ali acknowledged that West Indies were the better team and smarter with bat and ball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies won the five-match series 3-2.
England was missing injured captain Eoin Morgan and T20 regulars Jos Buttler and Ben Stokes.
